MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
As I push through the heavy door into the auditorium,
the distinctive dusty smell of the theater hits my nose.
This is the biggest theater in St. Iris. It has a long history and has hosted many famous plays in the past, and has produced many stars.

Verona is sitting on the edge of a large stage.
The "lost glass slippers" are still on her feet.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This theater is a special place for everyone involved in theater. The actors and the crew dream that one day their plays will be applauded in this auditorium.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: There are a lot of actors out there, but only a handful of them get to be here. It's an honor and a blessing to be given the chance.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Long, long before we were born. Long before we were born, a play called Cinderella, which was gaining popularity and fame in the provinces, was going to have a spectacular opening here.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: If only that incident hadn't happened...

The Cinderella Incident
is a tragedy etched in the history of the theater.
It all started two days before the curtain opened on the stage. One of the props, a glass slipper, that was to be used in the performance was lost.
It was the most important item in the story, but it was custom made to fit the feet of the actress playing the lead role, and there was no time left to prepare a replacement.
The actress who was to play the role of Cinderella suspected that it was the work of a senior actress from the same theater company; there had been a previous feud between the two rivals.

The conflict between the two escalated,
and finally the incident occurred.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The two actresses cursed at each other on a suspension bridge, and then they struggled and fell together. They never made it back.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
With their deaths, the production was cancelled.
Cinderella became a phantom play.
Verona gets up on her knees and gently caresses the surface of the glass shoes. It is as if she is listening to the voice of the shoes.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Since then, I've been thinking: Why did these shoes choose me and not the women who tried them on in the past? I wondered what else I could do.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I thought about it and thought about it.
In the end, this is all I could think of.
Verona stands up. In her hand, she holds a bundle of old papers. Written on the cover were the words "Cinderella". It was the title of the old script.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
On this stage, without an audience,
I will now perform Cinderella alone.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I want to act out Cinderella on this stage,
because I believe that is their wish and the reason they chose me.

All right. If there's anything I can do, just let me know.
I'll do whatever I can.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Good. Actually, there's something I'd like to ask you to do, Conductor, to make this play a success... By the way, do you have any acting experience?

When I my eyes widen at the unexpected question,
Verona laughs mischievously.

In the center of the large stage,
Verona is the only one in the spotlight.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I hear it...I hear it! That sound drifting on the wind is...
the sound of the bells announcing midnight!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's the promised time! No, the spell will be broken soon!
I must be back before the bell rings!

With that, she backs away,
flips the hem of her dress, and runs off.
It is a brilliantly passionate performance. Even though it's such a big space, I can feel Verona's emotion reaching every corner of the audience.
―I'm sure it will be conveyed. Verona's passionate feelings will surely soften and release the sorrow and suffering trapped in the glass slippers.
The story is now at its climax.
I wait for the right moment to go on stage, and then walk out and go to Verona, just as planned beforehand. In order to make this one-woman show a success, I must also fulfill an important mission.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: The Prince...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I believed it. I believed that you would come for me.
That even if I wasn't wearing a beautiful dress or jewels, you would find me.
I kneel down in front of Verona and gently lift her ankle. I gesture for her to put her shoes on my lap and then look up at her, as tears spill from Verona's eyes.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I love you. You, more than anyone else in this world...
Even though I know it's all an act, I can't help but be struck by the emotionally charged confession. I stand up and am about to hug Verona when I felt a surge of emotion.

With a heavy thud, the glass slippers suddenly fall to the floor.
The two of us look at each other unconsciously.
...They came off.
As soon as I mutter that, the glass slippers start to crumble like sand.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: My feelings reached her...My "Cinderella" was enough.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Thank goodness...Now she can finally head to heaven, right?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'm sure in a new life she'll be an actress.
One day she'll be on this stage again. I have a feeling.
Before I realize it, the glass slippers have disappeared without a trace. When I tell Verona she did well, somehow, she pitches her body towards me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Verona
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, no. The story must be told to the end. Don't we have one last act to do before Cinderella and the prince are united?
She says this with a serious face and closes her eyes softly.

Pulling her slender hips closer and slowly planting my lips on hers,
I can smell the faint scent of melon from Verona's body.
